column4: the hole deepens inb4 sexual joke: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/network-manager-applet/+bug/919885
can someone have a look and confirm my bug?
sure
thanks
waiting to hear about the bug...
does that spam in dmesg look normal?
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/network-manager-applet/+bug/919885
off the top of my head, i'd guess the wireless card isn't reinitializing correctly and consequently never reconnects
happens with both my ath9k inturnal wifi and usb rt2800usb alfa networks
I remember having had problems with an rt2400 series pci card that had to be started from a cold boot in order to initialize properly, but that was a long time ago
the situation does seem vaguely analogous, though
what do you suggest?
is it necessary to change mac addresses often, or can you just find one and leave it alone for a few days?
there is one network i need to access and it has mac filtering
dunno... i think some software has mac spoofing built in but this isn't the channel to discuss that kind of software ;)
software like macchanger?
i was thinking more like metasploit or something in that category... i haven't looked into it deeply but i think it can be done independently of the wireless card
I'm aware of that kind of stuff, I can hack any residentual security wifi network
and i'm still stuck ;d
*shrugs* then you're more knowledgable on the subject than i :)
hehe ;D
